articles.title: Greetings to Pakistani President
articles.content:
Greetings to Pakistani President
Pyongyang, March 22 (KCNA) -- Kim Yong Nam, president of the Presidium of the DPRK Supreme People's Assembly, Wednesday sent a message of greeting to Asif Ali Zardari, president of Pakistan, on the occasion of the Day of Pakistan, its national holiday.
					Kim in the message wished friendly Pakistan sustainable development and prosperity, convinced that the present bilateral relations of friendship and cooperation would go on favorably in future, too.

articles.title: DPRK Premier Congratulates Pakistani PM
articles.content:
DPRK Premier Congratulates Pakistani PM
Pyongyang, March 22 (KCNA) -- DPRK Premier Choe Yong Rim on March 21 sent a message Pakistani Prime Minister Syed Yusuf Raza Gilani, congratulating him on the Day of Pakistan.
					It wished the Pakistani government and people greater success in their work for independent progress and prosperity of the country and development of region, hoping that friendly and cooperative relations between the two countries will grow stronger.

articles.title: Irish President Hopes for Boosting Friendly, Cooperative Ties with DPRK
articles.content:
Irish President Hopes for Boosting Friendly, Cooperative Ties with DPRK
Pyongyang, March 22 (KCNA) -- Ireland hopes for boosting the friendly and cooperative relations with the DPRK in the political, economic, cultural and other fields, said the president of the Republic of Ireland on March 14.
					Micheal Higgins made the remark when he was presented with credentials from Hyon Hak Bong, DPRK ambassador to the country.
					
					The president expressed deep condolences again over the unexpected demise of leader Kim Jong Il.
					
					The friendly and cooperative relations between Ireland and the DPRK are developing on good terms in various fields after the establishment of diplomatic relations, the president said.
					
					The president wished the dear respected Kim Jong Un great success in his work for developing the country's economy and improving the standard of people's living.

articles.title: 57th Anniversary of Lao Political Party Marked in Pyongyang
articles.content:
57th Anniversary of Lao Political Party Marked in Pyongyang
Pyongyang, March 22 (KCNA) -- Lao Ambassador to the DPRK Kiettisak Keobanhdith on March 22 gave a reception at the Taedonggang Diplomatic Corps Club to mark the 57th anniversary of the Lao People's Revolutionary Party (LPRP).
					Present there on invitation were Secretary of the Central Committee of the Workers' Party of Korea Kim Yong Il and other officials concerned.
					
					Staff members of the Lao embassy here attended.
					
					Speeches were made there.

articles.title: DPRK Premier Updated on Construction of People's Theatre
articles.content:
DPRK Premier Updated on Construction of People's Theatre
Pyongyang, March 22 (KCNA) -- DPRK Premier Choe Yong Rim, on Mar. 22, acquainted himself on the spot with the construction of the People's Theatre which is taking its magnificent shape in the Mansudae area in Pyongyang.
					Leader Kim Jong Il chose the site for the theatre and clarified details of issues arising in the construction plan, orientation and its management to provide the Pyongyangites with more civilized cultural and entertainment life.
					
					True to the last instructions of Kim Jong Il, the soldier builders have pushed forward the project to bring earlier the day when they would make the report of completion to the dear respected Kim Jong Un.
					
					Going around the inside and outside of the theatre, Choe learned in detail about the construction in the final phase.
					
					He encouraged the builders to make the theatre an edifice in the era of Songun that would convey through generations the loving care shown by the peerlessly great persons for the people. He called for utilizing well the finishing materials and took steps for solving the issues related to the construction.

articles.title: First Secretary of Kim Il Sung Socialist Youth League Newly Elected in DPRK
articles.content:
First Secretary of Kim Il Sung Socialist Youth League Newly Elected in DPRK
Pyongyang, March 22 (KCNA) -- The 47th plenary meeting of the Central Committee of the Kim Il Sung Socialist Youth League was held in Pyongyang on Thursday.
					At the meeting former First Secretary Ri Yong Chol was relieved of his post for his age reason and Jon Yong Nam was elected to the post.

articles.title: KCNA-AP Joint Photo Exhibition Goes on in U.S.
articles.content:
KCNA-AP Joint Photo Exhibition Goes on in U.S.
Pyongyang, March 22 (KCNA) -- The photo exhibition co-sponsored by the Korean Central News Agency and the Associated Press of the U.S. which was opened in New York on March 15 to commemorate the centenary of the birth of President Kim Il Sung is going on, drawing concern and attention of the international community.
					Among the visitors to the exhibition hall are people from all walks of life and journalists in the U.S., New York citizens and Koreans in the U.S.
					
					Watching photos, they were deeply moved to see the true picture of the DPRK in which the leader, the army and people have formed a harmonious whole.
					
					The exhibition offered citizens in New York and Koreans in the U.S. and people of the world an opportunity to have a new idea and understanding of the DPRK.
					
					At least 700 media of the U.S. and media of the world vied with each other to report about the preparations for the exhibition and accounts of its opening.
					
					Xenyenshe of China said that photos on display reflect the harmonious whole of the leader and the people of the DPRK, the development of political, economic, cultural and other fields and the happy life of the people.
					
					The New York Times carried a photo feature.
					
					It carried a significant photo of leader Kim Jong Il with President Kim Il Sung and anti-Japanese war hero Kim Jong Suk.
					
					It also carried photos showing service personnel of the Korean People's Army determined to defend the party, the leader, the country and its people.
					
					AP Senior Vice President Kathleen Carroll said that the exhibition is offering people an opportunity to know about the DPRK.
					
					Many media of the world are giving wide publicity to photos on display.
					
					U.S. Internet homepages Wichita Eagle, Lex Go, OMG and other publications widely introduced the news of the exhibition.
					
					Donald Rubin, president of the Rubin Foundation, expressed hope that the exhibition would be the first step towards cultural and political reconciliation between the U.S. and the DPRK and that the governments of the two countries would get reconciled with this as a momentum.
					
					ITAR-TASS noted that the opening of the exhibition amounts to a series of thaw reflected in the DPRK-U.S. relations.
					
					AP reported in detail about the opening of the exhibition.
					
					U.S. Internet homepages Bradenton Herald, Huff Post, Monterey County The Herald, Local News, Las Cruces Sun-News, Deseret News and other media of different countries and regions gave wide publicity to the accounts of the exhibition under the title "Photo exhibit documents life inside North Korea".
					
					The exhibition continues.

articles.title: DPRK Soccer Team Comes Back Home
articles.content:
DPRK Soccer Team Comes Back Home
Pyongyang, March 22 (KCNA) -- The DPRK Men's soccer team flew back home Thursday after winning the 2012 AFC Challenger Cup in Nepal.

articles.title: DPRK Olympic Committee Meets
articles.content:
DPRK Olympic Committee Meets
Pyongyang, March 22 (KCNA) -- An annual meeting of the DPRK Olympic Committee took place at the People's Palace of Culture on Thursday.
					Present there were members of the Committee and officials in the field of physical culture and sports and relevant fields.
					
					The meeting reviewed the work of the Committee for 2011 and discussed the orientation of its work for 2012.
					
					A report by Pak Myong Chol, minister of Physical Culture and Sports and chairman of the Committee, was followed by speeches.
					
					They called for enhancing the functions and roles of the Committee and event-specific associations, and further developing Korean-style techniques for every sports event.

articles.title: Brief Biography of Kim Il Sung Published in DPRK
articles.content:
Brief Biography of Kim Il Sung Published in DPRK
Pyongyang, March 22 (KCNA) -- The DPRK brought out book "Brief Biography of the Great Leader Comrade Kim Il Sung" to mark the centenary of his birth. 
					The book summarizes the shining revolutionary life and immortal feats of the President. The book was published in August 1969, in March 1981 and in March 2000.
					
					The latest edition divides the history of his revolutionary activities into 12 stages. The book said:
					
					The President was born into a revolutionary and patriotic family. After embarking on the road of the revolution in his early years, he founded the Juche idea, Songun idea and indicated the path of the Korean revolution. He founded the anti-Japanese people's guerrilla army, the revolutionary armed forces on April 25, 1932 and annihilated the Japanese imperialist gangsters, liberating the country.
					
					After the country's liberation, he achieved the historic cause of the party founding and developed the Korean People's Revolutionary Army into the Korean People's Army, the regular revolutionary armed forces. He also successfully solved the problem of the power our own way and founded the DPRK.
					
					In the period of the Fatherland Liberation War, he aroused all the servicepersons and people to defeat U.S. imperialism and achieved the shining victory in the war. He held the posts of chairman of the Central Committee of the Workers' Party of Korea, chairman of the DPRK Military Commission, primer of the DPRK Cabinet and supreme commander of the KPA during the war.   
					
					In the postwar period he led the Koreans to rehabilitate the economy and turned the DPRK into the industrial-agricultural socialist state under the banner of self-reliance.
					
					In the subsequent period, he made sure that the historic task of the industrialization was successfully carried out in a short span of 14 years by effecting a great revolutionary surge, thus turning the DPRK into a powerful industrial socialist state.
					
					He entrusted leader Kim Jong Il with the work of the army late in the 1960s and thoroughly established his command system in the army and successfully solved the problem of carrying forward the revolutionary cause of Juche.
					
					He saw to it that the achievements of the industrialization were consolidated and the material and technical foundations of socialism were cemented to vigorously conduct the three revolutions --ideological, technological and cultural. He also set it forth as the general objective of the Korean revolution to model the whole society on the Juche idea at the Sixth Congress of the WPK, bringing about a decisive turn in the struggle for implementing it.
					
					He energetically led the revolution and construction without a moment's rest and passed away in his office. He devoted all his efforts to the prosperity of the socialist country and its reunification and the cause of global independence till the last moments of his life, the book concluded.

articles.title: New Books Off Press
articles.content:
New Books Off Press
Pyongyang, March 22 (KCNA) -- The Pyongyang Publishing House of the Democratic People's Republic of Korea has brought out new books.
					The books are "Benevolent Sun of Love" (Vols. 5 and 6) and "Option of Fate" (Vols. 1 and 2).
					
					The former contains stories about loving care leader Kim Jong Il showed for the people while bringing about an epoch-making turn in the effort for socialist construction and national reunification in the period from April 2002 to October 2010.
					
					The latter deals with practical experiences of writer Sok Yun Gi, poet Pak Se Yong, film director Pak Hak, and movie star O Hyang Mun and other men of literature and arts, who came under the care of the DPRK to lead a genuine, happy and worthwhile life. It also shows their pictures and introduces their careers.

articles.title: Korean People's Noble Traits of Upholding Kim Jong Il as Eternal Sun of Songun
articles.content:
Korean People′s Noble Traits of Upholding Kim Jong Il as Eternal Sun of Songun
Pyongyang, March 22 (KCNA) -- The 100th day since the unexpected demise of leader Kim Jong Il is a few days away. During those days the Korean people have enshrined in their hearts the firm belief that he will always live as the sun of Songun.
					Rodong Sinmun on Thursday says this in a by-lined article.
					
					All the Korean people have long upheld Kim Jong Il as the sun of their life, entrusting their destiny and future to him and remaining true to his Songun revolutionary leadership, the article says, and goes on:
					
					It was the unanimous mind of the Korean people that they cannot live without Kim Jong Il.
					
					During the 10-odd day official mourning period in December last year, about 260 million servicepersons and people visited the mourning stations across the country. And a huge crowd of people encircled the hearse bursting into tears on the day of bidding last farewell to him. These touching scenes impressively showed how pure and how sincere the Korean people were in upholding Kim Jong Il as the sun.
					
					Meetings, art performances and festivals took place at the highest level to commemorate the 70th birth anniversary of Kim Jong Il.
					
					The people devoted their all and showed every sincerity to spruce up the Kumsusan Palace of the Sun and erect the statue of Kim Jong Il. Work to build mosaics portraying smiling Kim Jong Il and towers to his immortality are under way in every part of the DPRK.
					
					The Korean people have regarded the ideas and feats of Kim Jong Il as the eternal treasure of the revolution and directed every effort to thoroughly implementing his last instructions during nearly 100 days.
					
					They have showed well their unshakable will to carry forward the revolution and construction as Kim Jong Il taught and the way he did despite whatever storm and stress.
					
					It is the true picture of the DPRK that all the servicepersons and people are working hard for the prosperity of the country, greatly encouraged by Kim Jong Il's strong sense of patriotism.

articles.title: Poem Representing High Aim for National Liberation
articles.content:
Poem Representing High Aim for National Liberation
Pyongyang, March 22 (KCNA) -- "Green Pine on Nam Hill" is a poem composed by an indomitable revolutionary Kim Hyong Jik with a high aim for liberating Korea from the Japanese colonial rule.
					The poem lively represents the indomitable revolutionary spirit and anti-Japanese patriotic idea he had kept in his lifetime.
					
					It calls for not abandoning the revolutionary struggle, however harsh the Japanese imperialists' suppression might be, and achieving the country's liberation with the effort of its people.
					
					The poem also enjoys a great popularity as a song among the local people.

articles.title: KNA, Organization for Anti-Japanese National Liberation Movement
articles.content:
KNA, Organization for Anti-Japanese National Liberation Movement
Pyongyang, March 22 (KCNA) -- An indomitable revolutionary, Kim Hyong Jik, organized the Korean National Association (KNA) on March 23, Juche 6 (1917) in order to unite the people under the idea of independence against imperialism and give a momentum to the anti-Japanese national liberation movement.
					In those days, nationalists were not taking a correct way of struggle, influenced by flunkeyism,
					
					Conducting activities separately spontaneously, the anti-Japanese organizations failed to take their roots deep into the masses.
					
					The situation required an organization which could afford to rally the people and give unified guidance over the anti-Japanese movement.
					
					Thereby, Kim Hyong Jik energetically pushed ahead with the work for forming a new organization.
					
					He toured several areas to get a firsthand knowledge of the independence movement, with Ponghwa-ri as the center of his activities.
					
					He paid big efforts to rallying hardcore members, before anything else.
					
					With full preparations, he formed the KNA in Haktanggol, Pyongyang.
					
					The KNA was the biggest revolutionary anti-Japanese underground organization based on broad masses of people at a time when Korea was completely under the military rule of the Japanese imperialists.

articles.title: 1.7 Million Visited Ponghwa Revolutionary Site
articles.content:
1.7 Million Visit Ponghwa Revolutionary Site in New Century
Pyongyang, March 22 (KCNA) -- The Ponghwa Revolutionary Site in Kangdong County, Pyongyang is visited by an endless stream of servicepersons and people of the DPRK on the 95th anniversary of the Korean National Association formed by Kim Hyong Jik, an indomitable revolutionary fighter. 
					Kim Hyong Jik stayed there from the middle of March 1916 to November 1917, leading the anti-Japanese national liberation struggle.
					
					There are his statue, Myongsin School, ground for morning exercises, Rock Floor, the Monument to Pisok-gye, the Maekjon Ferry, etc. 
					
					More than 1.7 million servicepersons, people from all walks of life and schoolchildren have visited the site in the new century.
					
					Visitors looked back on the revolutionary life and exploits of Kim Hyong Jik while looking round different places of the site.

articles.title: Lee Myung Bak Regime Hit for Its Confrontation Policy: Rodong Sinmun
articles.content:
Lee Myung Bak Regime Hit for Its Confrontation Policy: Rodong Sinmun
Pyongyang, March 22 (KCNA) -- The Lee Myung Bak regime of south Korea is made of heinous confrontation maniacs who have driven the inter-Korean relations to the worst catastrophe, challenging the desire of the Korean nation for independent reunification, says Rodong Sinmun Thursday in a bylined article.
					It goes on:
					
					The Lee group of traitors hell-bent on escalating confrontation with the compatriots has opposed the north-south declarations and deliberately pursued the anachronistic confrontation policy, backed by outside forces. 
					
					The Korean nation, aspiring after the national unity and reunification, has devoted all its efforts to accomplishing the independent reunification, peace and prosperity under the uplifted banner of June 15 Joint Declaration and October 4 Declaration. Nevertheless, a handful of traitors led by Lee have harshly quenched the sincere desire of the nation for reunification.
					
					The acute tension is now prevailing on the Korean Peninsula due to the unpardonable acts of the Lee group against the nation and its reunification.
					
					The traitors can never hide their true colors as anti-reunification elements as they have chilled the atmosphere of dialogue and peace and worked hard to provoke a war against the DPRK, pursuant to their anachronistic confrontation policy.
					
					They are now going reckless undermining the June 15 era of reunification. It would be impossible to prevent a nuclear war from breaking out on this land, much less achieving unity and reunification of the nation unless the criminal act of the Lee group is curbed. It is quite natural that the people of various circles in south Korea are hardening their resolve to resolutely punish the Lee group in the forthcoming "National Assembly" election as it blocked their movement for national reunification and plunged the north-south relations into complete deadlock.

articles.title: "Kim Il Sung's Korea", Special Write-ups to Centenary of His Birth (7)
articles.content:
"Kim Il Sung's Korea", Special Write-ups to Centenary of His Birth (7)
All-people Resistance for National Liberation
					
					Pyongyang, March 22 (KCNA) -- President Kim Il Sung led the all-people resistance for liberating the country.
					
					In the early days of the anti-Japanese revolutionary struggle he laid down the line of all-people resistance.
					
					The main idea of this line was that the only way for liberating the country from the Japanese imperialists' colonial rule was for all Koreans to turn out in an armed struggle against the aggressors.
					
					After the outbreak of the Sino-Japanese war in July Juche 26 (1937) Kim Il Sung took more active steps to carry the line of all-people resistance into practice. In September that year he issued an "Appeal to all Koreans" to give the Korean people a correct understanding of correlations between the Sino-Japanese war and the Koran revolution and encourage them to intensify their anti-Japanese struggle.
					
					He also guided the work to build resistance organizations throughout the country while awakening and rallying the masses of people in an organized way.
					
					During the anti-Japanese armed struggle he organized military and political training and short courses frequently to prepare the members of the Korean People's Revolutionary Army (KPRA) to successfully guide the coming all-people resistance.
					
					He also paid special attention to keeping all-people resistance organizations unified in action.
					
					In the late 1930s district party committees were formed to play the role as a regional leading body, with its mission to realize the unified guidance over the party groups and anti-Japanese mass organizations in various areas.
					
					Kim Il Sung pushed ahead with the work to train those resistance organizations militarily. After the announcement of the September appeal, he saw to it that the paramilitary groups and workers' shock brigades in different areas could go through military training for armed actions. In the first half of the 1940s he made effort to wind up such military preparedness. 
					
					He also worked to establish secret guerrilla bases for KPRA units' activities and all-people resistance forces in mountains of the country. 
					
					On August 9, 1945 an order of final attack was issued for the liberation of the country, and the ruling system of Japan in Korea came to collapse in a moment. This was ascribable to KPRA's general attack and activities of many resistance organizations conducted under Kim Il Sung's strategic plan.
					
					The Japanese imperialists suffered deathblow by KPRA's powerful attack and the armed resistance of all Korean people, and surrendered at discretion on August 15, 1945. 
					
					Thanks to Kim Il Sung's idea of achieving the independence of the country by the Korean people themselves and his wise leadership, the Korean people at last put an end to the atrocious colonial rule of 40 odd years by the Japanese imperialists and achieved the liberation of the country.
					
					The victory in the national liberation movement was the fruition of Kim Il Sung's absolute trust in his people's strength.

articles.title: S. Korean Authorities' Anti-DPRK Nuclear Racket Slammed
articles.content:
S. Korean Authorities' Anti-DPRK Nuclear Racket Slammed
Pyongyang, March 22 (KCNA) -- South Korea put police units in Seoul, Inchon and various areas of Kyonggi Province on b class alert from March 19 under the pretext of the "nuclear security summit," according to the south Korean CBS.
					Half of the police forces in those areas have entered into emergency duty.
					
					From March 23 the whole police forces are to be placed on a class alert.
					
					Now the south Korean puppet regime is kicking up frantic confrontation wind across south Korea ahead of the summit to turn it into a table of nuclear conspiracy against the DPRK.
					
					Fanning up the war fever in different places, it is citing possible provocation by someone before the summit.

articles.title: S. Korean Newspaper on Political Impact and Economic Efficiency of Kwangmyongsong-3
articles.content:
S. Korean Newspaper on Political Impact, Economic Efficiency of Kwangmyongsong-3
Pyongyang, March 22 (KCNA) -- Thongil News, an internet paper of south Korea, Tuesday carried an article titled "Political impact and economic efficiency of 'Kwangmyongsong-3'".
					The article said:
					
					The Korean Committee for Space Technology in a statement of its spokesman on March 16 announced that the DPRK will launch a working satellite, Kwangmyongsong-3, manufactured by itself with indigenous technology to mark the 100th birth anniversary of President Kim Il Sung. It also said the satellite will be blasted off from the Sohae Satellite Launching Station in Cholsan County, North Phyongan Province between April 12 and 16.
					
					The announcement immediately caught the world attention.
					
					Hankuk Ilbo said the north informed the U.S. State Department of the plan of the announcement of the satellite launch before releasing it. 
					
					A spokesperson for the U.S. State Department in a regular briefing on March 16 admitted the earlier contact between the DPRK and the U.S., saying that the New York channel went operational in the later hours on March 15 and the U.S. obviously conveyed the meaning of the satellite launch.
					
					The north side is of the stand that the planned launch is not contrary to the North-U.S. agreement. 
					
					Choson Sinbo, a Tokyo-based newspaper run by Koreans in Japan, said:
					
					According to the DPRK's plan, it is inevitable for it to launch earth observation satellite, a working satellite that would contribute to the economic development of the country, to mark the Day of the Sun in 2012 as the next stage of an experimental communications satellite that was launched in 2009. It was clear that the satellite launch plan had been promoted from years ago. It is the north's stand that moratorium on long-range missile launch and the satellite launch are separate issues.
					
					 
					
					Conventional Satellite: Equipment Essential for the DPRK's Economy
						
					
					Han Ho Sok, director of the Institute of Reunification, in an article titled "'Kwangmyongsong-3' is a satellite with transparency" quoted a statement of a spokesman for the Korean Committee for Space Technology on February 24, 2009 as saying, "Under the long-term national plan for space development, we look forward to launching working satellites for communications, resources prospecting, weather forecast, etc. crucial for the economic development of the country in years to come in the first phase and normalizing their operations."
					
					Chosun Sinbo on March 16, 2012 said that "Kwangmyongsong-3" to be launched by the north is a polar-orbiting earth observation satellite. 
					
					The weather satellite is urgently needed for getting awakened of the approach of summer typhoon and getting prepared for regional precipitation and torrential downpour. In particular, the weather information based on close photographing is essential to the north which made the increase of agricultural production a priority of the state.
					
					Lately the Korean Peninsula has suffered from flood owing to the torrential downpour in summer. The north has suffered from flood every year. It is true that this reduced the agricultural output and adversely affected various fields of the north's economy.
					
					The north authorities will naturally seek to get rich analysis of the images of approaching weather in the vicinity of the Korean Peninsula to increase the accuracy of the weather forecast.
					
					 
					
					Political Advantage of DPRK's Launch of Working Satellite
						
					
					As the DPRK is expected to start launching a working satellite, now is the time to consider the effectiveness of not only a rocket but a satellite. As a matter of fact, from the viewpoint of the DPRK, the system for putting a satellite into space made its debut in 2009 but what is noteworthy of the forthcoming launch is that a working satellite will be launched. 
					
					If Kwangmyongsong-3 which the DPRK is supposed to launch is a polar-orbiting meteorological satellite, it is the one for peaceful purposes. To acquire systematic weather information to protect agriculture and key industries from typhoon, torrential rain and draught is a work for a peaceful purpose for improving the living standard of the people in the DPRK. It, therefore, may not result in disturbing the stability in Northeast Asia but contributing to its peace and prosperity.
					
					It is not persuasive to claim that the north does not require a meteorological satellite though it must be in the south for stabilizing the people's life. As is the case with the south, the U.S. and Japan, the people in the north should do farming, catch fishes in seas and there is no other option for them to sensitively react to the weather conditions.
					
					If the projected launch of Kwangmyongsong-3 is a meteorological satellite as it was mentioned by the north in 2009, this will help the people in the north to escape from flood disasters and obtain systematic information about precipitation and thus increase agricultural production.

articles.title: S. Korean Organizations Launch Sit-down Strike for Peace against War
articles.content:
S. Korean Organizations Launch Sit-down Strike for Peace against War
Pyongyang, March 22 (KCNA) -- The Solidarity for Democracy, People's Life, Peaceful Reunification and Sovereignty and other civic and public organizations in south Korea formed an emergency sit-down strike group for peace against war before going into action in Seoul on Mar. 20.
					Prior to it, they held a press conference at Kwanghwamun.
					
					A press release was read out at the conference.
					
					The release accused Chongwadae and the Defense Ministry of taking military actions while pursuing the confrontation policy at a time when the tensions that were sparked off by the authorities' provocation of the north still run high.
					
					The authorities declared the day when the Cheonan ship was sunken as the "day of punishment" and are now calling the DPRK's planned launch of a satellite a "provocation", the release said, and added:
					
					This unprecedented serious crisis is totally attributable to the anti-DPRK confrontation policy of the Lee Myung Bak "government".
					
					Being forsaken by the people, the authorities are resorting to the unprecedented confrontation racket to tide over the ruling crisis.
					
					In order to handle today's situation Lee Myung Bak must immediately roll back the confrontation policy and apologize to the people.
					
					After the conference the group began the sit-down strike in Chonggye Square.

articles.title: Birth Anniversary of Kim Il Sung Marked by Koreans in Uzbekistan
articles.content:
Birth Anniversary of Kim Il Sung Marked by Koreans in Uzbekistan
Pyongyang, March 22 (KCNA) -- A photo exhibition took place on March 17 at the building of the Old Persons' Association for Korean Cultural Tradition in Uzbekistan to mark the centenary of the birth of President Kim Il Sung.
					On display in the venue were photos showing the undying feats President Kim Il Sung and leader Kim Jong Il performed for national reunification and the movement of overseas compatriots, and photos showing the development of Songun Korea.
					
					Present there on invitation were officials of the association, compatriots, charge d'affaires ad interim and staff members of the DPRK embassy.
					
					Chairman Ju Yong Il of the association made a speech.
					
					With the approach of the 100th birth anniversary of the President, he ardently yearns for Kim Il Sung's image of the sun and recalls with emotion immortal exploits he performed on behalf of the country and nation, Ju said, and went on:
					
					Kim Il Sung, father of socialist Korea, saved the country and its people from the Japanese imperialist colonial rule and glorified the dignity of the nation.
					
					The President, possessed of boundlessly noble popular traits, found himself among the people all his life and devoted his all to their happiness and the prosperity of all generations to come.
					
					Leader Kim Jong Il carried forward the idea of the President and defended the country with the Songun politics and fully demonstrated its might. 
					
					As the dear respected Kim Jong Un is brilliantly carrying forward the Juche cause of revolution, the future of the country is bright and the cause of building a thriving nation and national reunification will be creditably accomplished, he said.

articles.title: DPRK's Satellite Launch Will Show Off Its Space Technology: Koreans in China
articles.content:
DPRK's Satellite Launch Will Show Off Its Space Technology: Koreans in China
Pyongyang, March 22 (KCNA) -- The General Association of Koreans in China on March 19 made public a statement "Launch of Satellite Kwangmyongsong-3 will show off DPRK's space technology".
					The statement said the planned launch of an earth observation satellite in honor of the Day of the Sun will be a great auspicious event demonstrative of the fixed will of the DPRK to glorify for all ages the revolutionary exploits of President Kim Il Sung and leader Kim Jong Il.
					
					The proud news makes us miss Generalissimo Kim Jong Il more ardently than ever as he made the DPRK rank itself with dignity among nuclear weapons states, and led it to manufacture and launch satellites, while leading the nation's on-ward march toward 2012, it said.
					
					The south Korean puppets are alleging that the launch is a "disguised missile test", but such a remark can be made only by those in fear of the might of the DPRK, it said.
					
					The world will clearly see no one on earth can match the might of the DPRK led by the dear respected Kim Jong Un, great brilliant commander of Songun, and its huge scientific and technological potentials, it stressed.

articles.title: DPRK's Planned Satellite Launch Does Not Fall Foul of Int'l Regulations: Russian Figure
articles.content:
DPRK's Planned Satellite Launch Does Not Fall Foul of Int'l Regulations: Russian Figure
Pyongyang, March 22 (KCNA) --   Baranikova, editor-in-chief of a newspaper of Vladivostok of Russia, released a statement on March 17 in support of a statement of the spokesman for the Korean Committee of Space Technology.
					Many people who heard the statement of the spokesman think that the DPRK's satellite launch does not fall foul of international regulations but would be beneficial one that does not pose a threat to the security in Northeast Asia, the editor-in-chief said, adding:
					
					"The DPRK will continue turning the achievements in the field of space into good account for the happiness of the people.
					
					The DPRK's space and nuclear development for peaceful purposes is not contrary to international law and the UN Charter.
					
					The launch of satellite Kwangmyongsong-3 will be a significant event in honor of the centenary of the birth of President Kim Il Sung.
					
					I hope that the DPRK's working satellite will be launched with success to the delight of all the people who look forward to it."

articles.title: No Ground to Assert What DPRK Is Going to Launch Is Not Satellite: Chinese Newspaper
articles.content:
No Ground to Assert What DPRK Is Going to Launch Is Not Satellite: Chinese Newspaper
Beijing, March 21 (KCNA) -- Huan Qiu Shibao on March 20 carried an article titled "The DPRK should be given an opportunity of showing sincerity." The paper issued by the People's Daily Office of China said:
					The DPRK announced that it would launch an observation satellite Kwangmyongsong-3 in the middle of April. This announcement surprised the people but the DPRK's assertion has every reason. The international community should observe it with calm and give the DPRK an opportunity of proving its honesty. 
					
					The reason for the strong reaction on the sides of the U.S., Japan and south Korea lies not in the type of satellite but in the carrier rocket Unha-3. 
					
					According to their theory, a rocket has just the same principle as a ballistic missile and it is convertible to a ballistic missile any time. But there is no evidential proof that what the DPRK is going to launch will not be a satellite. 
					
					The DPRK announced that it would invite world's experienced experts and journalists to the launching station to prove that it is a satellite that it plans to launch.
					
					This also reflects the DPRK's sincerity when viewed from another angle. 
					
					It is the intention of the DPRK to settle disputes by taking note of the world reaction and by increasing transparency. This attitude deepens people's trust that what the DPRK is going to launch may be truly a satellite. 
					
					In case the DPRK proves it, this will considerably downplay the reasoning the U.S., Japan and south Korea will make to pressure the DPRK citing the UN "Resolution" 1874. It is because the DPRK has refused to accept the UN "resolution" and the UN does not have any regulations curbing a sovereign country from launching an earth observation satellite from its own land. 
					
					As the DPRK asserts, the U.S., Japan and south Korea launched even spy satellites for military use. 
					
					UN "Resolution" 1874 offers the DPRK enough reason to chide south Korea where the situation is similar to it. 
					
					Under these circumstances, the international community should take time before denouncing the DPRK and shaping a new confrontation policy and take this opportunity to monitor the DPRK so that it may increase transparency and refrain from converting a rocket into an intercontinental ballistic missile (ICBM). 
					
					If the DPRK truly intends to develop the missile, that will aim to defuse the threat coming from afar and survive. This requires the neighboring countries to jointly work to make the DPRK feel safe so that it can refrain from developing ICBM. In particular, those countries hostile to the DPRK are required to study how to dispel mutual hostility. 
					
					In fact, whether the DPRK's satellite launch will deteriorate the regional situation or not depends on the response of the U.S., Japan and south Korea. They all benefited from "missile crises" of the DPRK in the past. 
					
					They developed spy satellite and missile defense system and tried to develop long-range ballistic missile system. This time will be of no exception. In case the U.S., Japan and south Korea strongly respond, the situation will naturally turn worse. 
					
					Therefore, parties concerned should wait with calm for the DPRK's publication of the results of the launch. 
					
					At present, the DPRK does not seem to cancel the launch plan. So, there is no need to take more hostile approach to the DPRK.

articles.title: Kim Il Sung's Work Off Press in Brazil
articles.content:
Kim Il Sung's Work Off Press in Brazil
Pyongyang, March 22 (KCNA) -- A publishing house in Brazil brought out in booklet President Kim Il Sung's work "Young People Must Accomplish the Revolutionary Cause of Juche, Upholding the Leadership of the Party" on March 15.
					The work, published on February 22 in 1993, clarifies that young Koreans have successfully played the role as vanguard of the revolution. It also indicates the tasks and ways for carrying forward the Korean revolution through generations.

articles.title: Birth Anniversary of Kim Il Sung Marked in Finland
articles.content:
Birth Anniversary of Kim Il Sung Marked in Finland
Pyongyang, March 22 (KCNA) -- Political parties and organizations of Finland held a joint meeting on March 13 to commemorate the centenary of the birth of President Kim Il Sung.
					On display in the venue were books and photos of the achievements made by the DPRK in socialist construction.
					
					Antti Sika Aho, chairman of the Finland-Korea Society, in a speech said that Kim Il Sung was a rare statesman and distinguished state leader who ushered in a new Juche era and developed the DPRK into an independent socialist state.
					
					Kim Il Sung founded the immortal Juche idea and successfully embodied it to make the Korean people strong in the sense of independence, the chairman noted, and went on:
					
					"The President's revolutionary idea has been successfully carried forward by leader Kim Jong Il and the dear respected Kim Jong Un.
					
					The friends of Koreans in Finland sincerely wish the Korean people greater achievements in the building of a powerful country under the leadership of Kim Jong Un."
					
					Kalevi Wahrman, chairman of the Finnish Communists' League, said that the feats performed by Kim Il Sung will always remain in their hearts, adding that they will remain unchanged in expressing support and solidarity with the Korean people in their just cause.
					
					Hannu Harju, chairman of the Communist Workers' Party of Finland for the Peace and Socialism, praised the exploits of Kim Il Sung.
					
					The chairman went on to say:
					
					"Kim Jong Il turned the DPRK into a military power with his Songun leadership. We absolutely support the Songun politics of the DPRK.
					
					The DPRK will as ever win a victory after another thanks to the Songun leadership of Kim Jong Un."
					
					A letter to Kim Jong Un was adopted at the meeting.

articles.title: Countries Should Follow Songun Politics: Nepalese Newspaper
articles.content:
Countries Should Follow Songun Politics: Nepalese Newspaper
Pyongyang, March 22 (KCNA) -- The March 13th issue of Majodur, organ of the Nepal Worker-Peasant Party, carried an article titled "Songun Politics".
					The article noted that under the Japanese imperialist colonial rule over Korea, President Kim Il Sung founded the original Songun idea with two pistols his father left to him.
					
					Leader Kim Jong Il developed in depth the Songun idea founded by the President, the article said, and continued:
					
					It was thanks to the Songun politics pursued by Kim Jong Il that the Korean People's Army has developed into the army devotedly serving the party, leader, country and people, and the invincible revolutionary army faithful to the idea and leadership of the Workers' Party of Korea.
					
					The situation of some countries proved that it would be impossible to defend the destiny of the country and people, let alone guarantee independence, if the army is weak.
					
					The Songun politics is a political mode to be followed by all countries and nations aspiring after independence.
					
					Following the Songun politics of Kim Jong Il are a number of countries in the world which agreed with its vitality.
					
					Songun also guarantees the economic development of the countries.

articles.title: Caribbean Nations Advance with Independence against Imperialism
articles.content:
Caribbean Nations Advance with Independence against Imperialism
Pyongyang, March 22 (KCNA) -- Caribbean nations have strengthened cooperation, firmly united under the banner of independence against imperialism.
					Government heads of 15 Caribbean countries Friday concluded their two-day annual meet with a host of agreements on strengthening regional security, economic cooperation and climate change.
					
					The 23rd Inter-Sessional Meeting of the Conference of Heads of Government of the Caribbean Community and Common Market (CARICOM) was held in Paramaribo, Suriname's capital.
					
					Member countries agreed that regional security remains a top priority. The meeting called on participants to continue to contribute the necessary resources and devise creative means to facilitating the region's security framework and management.
					
					Also stressed at the meeting was the importance for the CARICOM member states to increase their own capability to explore resources and lessen the dependence on foreign aids.
					
					As for economic cooperation, participants agreed to establish a regional commercial enterprise to invest in the exploration of the region's natural resources.
					
					Participants also approved the "Implementation Plan for the Regional Framework for Achieving Development Resilient to Climate Change," a blueprint that defines the region's strategic approach to cope with climate change from 2011 to 2021.
					
					Barbados expected to receive the benefits of natural gas supplied from Trinidad and Tobago with the construction of a 300-kilometer natural gas pipeline between the two countries.
					
					CARICOM has protected the interests of the regional countries and steadily pushed forward the work for developing national economy through economic cooperation among member nations while standing against all sorts of domination moves of foreign forces.
					
					The regional countries are working hard to strengthen political cooperation with other Latin American countries and socio-economic cooperation among them which aspire after self-supporting development on the principle of independence against imperialism.
					
					At a special session they discussed how to fight AIDS and other sexually-transmitted diseases.
					
					Participants agreed to work together in a joint program to fight those illnesses.
					
					And at the meeting of ministries of Energy they defined regional oil price and made an energy policy for guaranteeing the security of its supply in coping with the worldwide oil price uprising.

articles.title: Cuba Condemns Israeli Attacks against Palestine
articles.content:
Cuba Condemns Israeli Attacks against Palestine
Pyongyang, March 22 (KCNA) -- Cuba condemns in the strongest terms Israel's aggressions against the Palestinian people, Cuba's permanent representative in Geneva said on Monday
					Speaking in the debate on the issue of the humanitarian situation in Palestine and other occupied territories, the representative warned that the nation is still deprived of its fundamental rights, including self-determination.
					
					The ambassador called for the cessation of the construction and expansion of illegal Israeli settlements and the confiscation of Palestinian land.

articles.title: Israel Has No Right to Intervene in UNHRC Activities: Hamas
articles.content:
Israel Has No Right to Intervene in UNHRC Activities: Hamas
Pyongyang, March 22 (KCNA) -- The Islamic Hamas movement on Monday said Israel has no right to intervene in the activities of the United Nations Human Rights Council (UNHRC), in response to the Israeli rejection of a Hamas official's participation in a UNHRC meeting.
					Israel tries to mislead the international public opinion from its crimes, the organization said, urging the UNHRC to force Israel to respect human rights and release the jailed Palestinian lawmakers.

articles.title: Japan's Prefectural Assembly Opposes U.S. Marines Relocation
articles.content:
Japan's Prefectural Assembly Opposes U.S. Marines Relocation
Pyongyang, March 22 (KCNA) -- The Yamaguchi Prefectural Assembly of Japan opposed the relocation of U.S. marines.
					The assembly on Mar. 16 unanimously adopted a letter of intent opposing the relocation of some 1 500 U.S. marines in Okinawa to Iwaguni base, saying it would mean additional burdens on the locals.
					
					It voiced strong opposition to temporary deployment in Iwaguni base of VTOL plane which drew criticism for crash accident in the development phase and for its noise.

articles.title: Cooperation among Different Countries
articles.content:
Cooperation among Different Countries
Pyongyang, March 22 (KCNA) -- China and Albania Saturday agreed to strengthen exchanges to push forward bilateral cooperation in politics, economy, culture, education and other areas.
					Cuba and Costa Rica Friday signed two agreements to strengthen the relations between the two countries in the political and cultural fields.

articles.title: Choe Yong Rim dirige Teatro del Pueblo en zona Mansudae
articles.content:
Choe Yong Rim dirige Teatro del Pueblo en zona Mansudae
Pyongyang, 22 de marzo (ACNC) -- El premier coreano Choe Yong Rim averiguo el dia 22 en el terreno el estado de la construccion del Teatro del Pueblo que muestra su fisonomia en la zona de Mansudae.
					Para ofrecer a los capitalinos la civilizada condicion de la vida cultural, el Dirigente          Kim Jong Il selecciono el terreno para la construccion del teatro y aclaro detalladamente el plan y el rumbo de la obra y la gestion del edificio.
					
					En acato al legado del Dirigente, los constructores militares aceleraron la obra para adelantar el dia de dar al Maximo Dirigente Kim Jong Un el parte de  culminacion.
					
					Recorriendo el interior y el exterior del teatro, Choe se cercioro en detalles del estado de la construccion en la ultima etapa.
					
					Estimulo a los constructores quienes levantan magnificamente el teatro que transmitira para siempre el amor al pueblo de los grandes hombres sin pares como creacion monumental de la epoca del Songun y tomo las medidas para usar bien los materiales de acabado y resolver los problemas pendientes  en la construccion.

articles.title: Sustituido primer secretario del CC de UJS en RPDC
articles.content:
Sustituido primer secretario del CC de UJS en RPDC
Pyongyang, 22 de marzo (ACNC) -- Tuvo lugar el dia 22 en esta capital la 47a sesion plenaria del Comite Central de la Union de la Juventud Socialista Kim Il Sung.
					En el foro destituyo al primer secretario del CC de la UJS Ri Yong Chol en relacion con la edad avanzada y eligio a Jon Yong Nam en lugar de Ri. a dicho cargo.

articles.title: Efectuada asamblea anual del Comite Olimpico de RPDC
articles.content:
Efectuada asamblea anual del Comite Olimpico de RPDC
Pyongyang, 22 de marzo (ACNC) -- Tuvo lugar el dia 22 en el capitalino Palacio Cultural del Pueblo la asamblea general del Comite Olimpico de la Republica Popular Democratica de Corea con la  participacion de los miembros del citado comite y los funcionarios de la rama deportiva y otros sectores.
					El foro hizo balance del trabajo del Comite Olimpico de la RPDC en 2011 y discutio la direccion de labor para 2012.
					
					Pak Myong Chol, presidente de la entidad y ministro de Deportes, presento el informe y hubo intervenciones. 
					
					Los oradores insistieron en la necesidad de elevar la funcion y el papel del Comite Olimpico y las asociaciones de diferentes disciplinas deportivas y desarrollar las tecnologias deportivas al estilo coreano.

articles.title: Rodong Sinmun denuncia anacronica politica conflictiva de Lee Myung Bak
articles.content:
Rodong Sinmun denuncia anacronica politica conflictiva de Lee Myung Bak
Pyongyang, 22 de marzo (ACNC) -- En un articulo individual difundido este jueves, el diario Rodong Sinmun senala que los maniacos conflictivos de Lee Myung Bak llevaron las relaciones intercoreanas al estado catastrofico desafiando a la aspiracion de la nacion coreana a la reunificacion independiente, y continua:
					Ellos negaron las declaraciones Norte-Sur y persiguieron la anacronica politica conflictiva en contubernio con las fuerzas extranjeras.
					
					Los connacionales aspirantes a la unidad de la nacion y la reunificacion del pais lucharon dedicando sin titubeo la sangre y el sudor por lograr la reunificacion independiente, la paz y la prosperidad con la bandera de la Declaracion Conjunta del 15 de Junio y la Declaracion del 4 de Octubre.
					
					Pero, un minimo de estas fuerzas traidoras pisoteo brutalmente el deseo de los connacionales por la  reunificacion.
					
					Debido a las imperdonables locuras antinacionales y anti-reunificacion de estas se ha creado ahora en la Peninsula Coreana la tension muy aguda.
					
					No se puede ocultar con nada la naturaleza anti-reunificacion de la banda de Lee que rompio el ambiente del dialogo y la paz dependiendo de su anacronica politica conflictiva y actua con frenesi  por la provocacion de guerra anti-RPDC.
					
					Si se dejan intactas las maquinaciones criminales de estas fuerzas que niegan la epoca del 15 de junio por la reunificacion, no se puede lograr la unidad de la nacion y la reunificacion y, a la larga, se desencadenara la guerra nuclear sobre esta tierra.
					
					Es natural que los habitantes de distintos sectores del Sur de Corea intenten sentenciar en las "elecciones de parlamentarios" a la camarilla de Lee que pisoteo el movimiento por la reunificacion de la patria y congelo las relaciones intercoreanas.
